intro: Phlegmariurus mingjoui, commonly known as the Mingjou moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories or on rocky surfaces. The plant exhibits a thalloid structure, with a leafy, greenish appearance that is often covered in a layer of fine, translucent cells. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporocarps. Due to its limited distribution, Phlegmariurus mingjoui is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
